children.name: pdfExport
children.description: Fired when the user initiates PDF export.

children.name: excelImport
Example - monitor the progress of an import operation

children.description: Fired when the user clicks the "Open" toolbar button.

children.name: excelExport
Example - subscribe to the "excelExport" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "excelExport" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user clicks the "Export to Excel" toolbar button.

children.name: render
children.description: Triggered after the widget has completed rendering.

children.name: change
children.description: Triggered when a value in the spreadsheet has been changed. Introduced in 2016.Q1.SP1.

children.name: fromJSON

parameters.name: data `Object`
parameters.description: The object to load data from.  This should be **the deserialized object**, not the JSON string.

children.description: Loads the workbook data from an object with the format defined in the [configuration](#configuration).> All existing sheets and their data will be lost.

children.name: toJSON
children.description: Serializes the workbook in the format defined in the [configuration](#configuration).

children.name: renameSheet

parameters.name: newSheetName `String`
parameters.description: The new name of the sheet.

parameters.name: sheet `kendo.spreadsheet.Sheet`
parameters.description: The sheet instance to rename.

children.description: Renames the specified sheet.

children.name: removeSheet

parameters.name: sheet `kendo.spreadsheet.Sheet`
parameters.description: The sheet instance to remove.

children.description: Removes the specified sheet.

children.name: moveSheetToIndex

parameters.name: index `Number`
parameters.description: The new zero-based index of the sheet.

parameters.name: sheet `kendo.spreadsheet.Sheet`
parameters.description: The sheet instance to move.

children.description: Moves the sheet to the specified index.

children.name: insertSheet

parameters.name: options.data `Object`
parameters.description: The sheet state and data as `Object`.  The schema follows the same structure as the [widget configuration](/api/javascript/ui/spreadsheet#configuration).

parameters.name: options.dataSource  `kendo.data.DataSource`
parameters.description: The data source for this sheet.

parameters.name: options.headerWidth `Number`
parameters.description: The header column width in pixels.

parameters.name: options.headerHeight `Number`
parameters.description: The header row height in pixels.

parameters.name: options.columnWidth `Number`
parameters.description: The column width in this sheet in pixels.

parameters.name: options.rowHeight `Number`
parameters.description: The row height in this sheet in pixels.

parameters.name: options.columns `Number`
parameters.description: The number of columns in this sheet.

parameters.name: options.rows `Number`
parameters.description: The number of rows in this sheet.

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: The configuration options for the sheet.

children.description: Inserts a sheet with the specified options.

children.name: sheetByIndex

parameters.name: index `Number`
parameters.description: The index of the sheet to locate.

children.description: Locates a sheet by its index in the workbook.

children.name: sheetIndex

parameters.name: sheet `kendo.spreadsheet.Sheet`
parameters.description: The sheet to determine the index of.

children.description: Returns the index of the specified sheet.

children.name: sheetByName

parameters.name: name `String`
parameters.description: The name of the sheet to locate.

children.description: Returns a sheet matching the specified name, if any.

children.name: saveAsPDF

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: An options object with the same structure as the [pdf](#configuration-pdf) options.

children.description: Initiates the PDF export. Also fires the [`pdfExport`](#events-pdfExport) event.> Calling this method could trigger the browser built-in popup blocker in some cases. To avoid that, always call it as a response to an end-user action e.g. button click.

children.name: saveAsExcel
children.description: Initiates the Excel export. Also fires the [`excelExport`](#events-excelExport) event.> Calling this method could trigger the browser built-in popup blocker in some cases. To avoid that, always call it as a response to an end-user action e.g. button click.

children.name: fromFile

parameters.name: blob `Blob|File`
parameters.description: The file or blob, usually obtained through a file input.

children.description: Clears the spreadsheets and populates it with data from the specified Excel (.xlsx) file.> Requires Internet Explorer 10 or a recent version of other browsers.

children.name: sheets
children.description: Returns an array with the sheets in the workbook.

children.name: activeSheet

parameters.name: sheet `kendo.spreadsheet.Sheet` *optional*
parameters.description: The sheet to set as active.

children.description: Gets or sets the active sheet.

children.name: toolbar.data
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the "insert" tab should be displayed or a collection of tools that will be shown in the "insert" tab.The available tools are:* **sort*** **filter*** **validation**

children.name: toolbar.insert
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the "insert" tab should be displayed or a collection of tools that will be shown in the "insert" tab.The available tools are:* [ **addColumnLeft**, **addColumnRight**, **addRowBelow**, **addRowAbove** ]* [ **deleteColumn**, **deleteRow** ]Those tools which are part of a tool group are defined as array. For example `["deleteColumn", "deleteRow"]`

children.name: toolbar.home
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the "home" tab should be displayed or a collection of tools that will be shown in the "home" tab.The available tools are:* **open*** **exportAs*** [**cut**, **copy**, **paste**]* [**bold**, **italic**, **underline**]* **backgroundColor**, **textColor*** **borders*** **fontSize**, **fontFamily*** **alignment*** **textWrap*** [**formatDecreaseDecimal**, **formatIncreateDecimal**]* **format*** **merge*** **freeze*** **filter**Those tools which are part of a tool group are defined as array. For example `["bold", "italic", "underline"]`

children.name: toolbar
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the toolbar should be displayed.

children.name: sheetsbar
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the sheetsbar should be displayed.

children.name: sheets.sort.ref
children.description: The sorted range, e.g. "A1:D5".

children.name: sheets.sort.columns.index
children.description: The index of the column **within the sheet**.For example, column C will have index 2.

children.name: sheets.sort.columns.ascending
children.description: Indicates if the data in the cell should be sorted ascending (`true`) or descending or (`false`).

children.name: sheets.sort.columns
children.description: Specifies the sort options for individual columns.

children.name: sheets.sort
children.description: Defines the sort criteria for the sheet.

children.name: sheets.selection
children.description: The selected range in the sheet, e.g. "A1:B10".

children.name: sheets.rows.index
children.description: The absolute row index. Required to ensure correct positioning.

children.name: sheets.rows.height
children.description: The row height in pixels. Defaults to [rowHeight](#configuration-rowHeight).

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.wrap
children.description: Will wrap the cell content if set to `true`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.verticalAlign
children.description: The vertical align setting for the cell content.Available options are:* left* center* right* justify

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.titleTemplate
children.description: Defines the *hint* title that will be displayed if value is invalid.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.messageTemplate
children.description: Defines the *hint* message that will be displayed if value is invalid.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.allowNulls
children.description: Specifies whether to allow nulls.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.to
children.description: Defines a *formula* or *value* used for the comparison process. Will be used if comparer type requies second argument.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.from
children.description: Defines a *formula* or *value* used for the comparison process. Used as *only* if comparer type does not require second argument.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.dataType
children.description: Defines the data type of the cell value.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.comparerType
children.description: Defines the comparer type used to validate the cell value, e.g. "greaterThan", "between" and etc.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation.type
children.description: Defines the validation type. The acceptable options are *reject* or *warning*

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.validation
Initialize Spreadsheet with validation data, using `sheets.rows` configuration option

children.description: The validation rule applied to the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.value
children.description: The cell value.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.underline
children.description: Sets the cell font to underline, if set to `true`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.textAlign
children.description: The text align setting for the cell content.Available options are:* left* center* right* justify

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.index
children.description: The zero-based index of the cell. Required to ensure correct positioning.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.formula
children.description: The cell formula **without the leading equals** sign, e.g. `A1 * 10`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.format
children.description: The format of the cell text.See [Create or delete a custom number format on MS Office](https://support.office.com/en-au/article/Create-or-delete-a-custom-number-format-78f2a361-936b-4c03-8772-09fab54be7f4).

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.enable
children.description: Disables the cell, if set to `false`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.bold
children.description: Sets the cell font to bold, if set to `true`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.italic
children.description: Sets the cell font to italic, if set to `true`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.fontSize
children.description: The font size of the cell in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.fontFamily
children.description: The font family for the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.color
children.description: The font color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderRight.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderRight.color
children.description: The right border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderRight
children.description: The style information for the right border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderTop.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderTop.color
children.description: The top border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderTop
children.description: The style information for the top border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderLeft.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderLeft.color
children.description: The left border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderLeft
children.description: The style information for the left border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderBottom.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderBottom.color
children.description: The bottom border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderBottom
children.description: The style information for the bottom border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.background
children.description: The background color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells
children.description: The cells for this row.

children.name: sheets.rows
children.description: The row data for this sheet.

children.name: sheets.mergedCells
children.description: An array of merged cell ranges, e.g. "B1:D2".

children.name: sheets.frozenRows
children.description: The number of frozen rows in this sheet.

children.name: sheets.frozenColumns
children.description: The number of frozen columns in this sheet.

children.name: sheets.filter.ref
children.description: The active range for the filter, e.g. "B1:D8".

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.values
children.description: The filter values for filters that support multiple values.

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.value
children.description: The filter value for filters that require a single value, e.g. "top".

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.type
children.description: The filter sub-type, if any.Applicable types according to the [main filter](#configuration-sheets.filter.columns.filter).* top    * topNumber    * topPercent    * bottomNumber    * bottomPercent* dynamic    * aboveAverage    * belowAverage    * tomorrow    * today    * yesterday    * nextWeek    * thisWeek    * lastWeek    * nextMonth    * thisMonth    * lastMonth    * nextQuarter    * thisQuarter    * lastQuarter    * nextYear    * thisYear    * lastYear    * yearToDate

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.logic
children.description: The logical operator to apply to [filter criteria](#configuration-sheets.filter.columns.criteria).Possible values are `and`, `or`.

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.index
children.description: The index of the column **relative to** the [filter range](#configuration-sheets.filter.ref).

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.filter
children.description: The filter to apply to this column.The supported filters are:  * value - filters based on unique values  * custom - applies custom filtering criteria  * top - filters the top or bottom records  * dynamic - filters based on dynamic criteria

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.criteria.value
children.description: The value for the criteria operator.

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.criteria.operator
children.description: The criterion operator type.Supported types vary based on the inferred column data type (inferred):* Text    * contains - the text contains the value    * doesnotcontain - text does not contain the value    * startswith - text starts with the value    * endswith - text ends with the value* Date    * eq -  date is the same as the value    * neq - date is not the same as the value    * lt -  date is before the value    * gt -  date is after the value* Number    * eq - is equal to the value    * neq - is not equal to the value    * gte - is greater than or equal to the value    * gt - is greater than the value    * lte - is less than or equal to the value    * lt - is less than the value

children.name: sheets.filter.columns.criteria
children.description: An array of filter criteria for custom filters.

children.name: sheets.filter.columns
children.description: An array defining the filter configuration of individual columns.

children.name: sheets.filter
children.description: Defines the filtering criteria for this sheet, if any.

children.name: sheets.dataSource
children.description: The data source instance for this sheet.See [Bind to Data Source](/web/spreadsheet/import-and-export-data/bind-to-data-source).

children.name: sheets.columns.width
children.description: The width of the column in pixels. Defaults to [columnWidth](#configuration-columnWidth).

children.name: sheets.columns.index
children.description: The zero-based index of the column. Required to ensure correct positioning.

children.name: sheets.columns
children.description: An array defining the columns in this sheet and their content.

children.name: sheets.name
children.description: The name of the sheet.

children.name: sheets.activeCell
children.description: The active cell in the sheet, e.g. "A1".

children.name: sheets
children.description: An array defining the document sheets and their content.

children.name: rows
children.description: The number of rows in the document.

children.name: rowHeight
children.description: The default row height in pixels.

children.name: pdf.vCenter
children.description: An option indicating whether to center the content vertically.See also [hCenter](#configuration-pdf.hCenter).

children.name: pdf.title
children.description: Sets the title of the PDF file.

children.name: pdf.subject
children.description: Sets the subject of the PDF file.

children.name: pdf.proxyTarget
Example - open the generated document in a new window

children.description: A name or keyword indicating where to display the document returned from the proxy.If you want to display the document in a new window or iframe,the proxy should set the "Content-Disposition" header to `inline; filename="<fileName.pdf>"`.

children.name: pdf.proxyURL
Example - set the server proxy URL

children.description: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally e.g. Internet Explorer 9 and Safari. PDF export is not supported in Internet Explorer 8 and below.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:* contentType: The MIME type of the file* base64: The base-64 encoded file content* fileName: The file name, as requested by the caller.The proxy should return the decoded file with the "Content-Disposition" header set to`attachment; filename="<fileName.pdf>"`.

children.name: pdf.paperSize
children.description: Specifies the paper size of the PDF document.The default "auto" means paper size is determined by content.> The size of the content in pixels will match the size of the output in points (1 pixel = 1/72 inch).Supported values:* A predefined size: "A4", "A3" etc* An array of two numbers specifying the width and height in points (1pt = 1/72in)* An array of two strings specifying the width and height in units.  Supported units are "mm", "cm", "in" and "pt".

children.name: pdf.margin.top
children.description: The top margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.right
children.description: The right margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.left
children.description: The left margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.bottom
children.description: The bottom margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin
children.description: Specifies the margins of the page (numbers or strings with units). Supportedunits are "mm", "cm", "in" and "pt" (default).

children.name: pdf.landscape
children.description: Set to `true` to reverse the paper dimensions if needed such that width is the larger edge.

children.name: pdf.keywords
children.description: Specifies the keywords of the exported PDF file.

children.name: pdf.hCenter
children.description: An option indicating whether to center the content horizontally.See also [vCenter](#configuration-pdf.vCenter).

children.name: pdf.guidelines
children.description: An option indicating whether to export the cell guidelines.

children.name: pdf.forceProxy
children.description: If set to true, the content will be forwarded to [proxyURL](#configuration-pdf.proxyURL) even if the browser supports saving files locally.

children.name: pdf.fitWidth
Example - fit spreadsheet to page width

children.description: An option indicating whether to fit the spreadsheet content to page width.

children.name: pdf.fileName
Example - set the default PDF file name

children.description: Specifies the file name of the exported PDF file.

children.name: pdf.date
children.description: The date when the PDF document is created. Defaults to `new Date()`.

children.name: pdf.creator
children.description: The creator of the PDF document.

children.name: pdf.author
children.description: The author of the PDF document.

children.name: pdf.area
children.description: The area to export. Possible values:* "workbook": Exports the full workbook, including all sheets.* "sheet": Exports the active sheet.* "selection": Exports the selected area on the active sheet.

children.name: pdf
children.description: Configures the Kendo UI Spreadsheet PDF export settings.

children.name: excel.proxyURL
Example - set the server proxy URL

children.description: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally.Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:* contentType: The MIME type of the file* base64: The base-64 encoded file content* fileName: The file name, as requested by the caller.The proxy should return the decoded file with the "Content-Disposition" header set to`attachment; filename="<fileName.xslx>"`.

children.name: excel.forceProxy
children.description: If set to true, the content will be forwarded to [proxyURL](#configuration-excel.proxyURL) even if the browser supports saving files locally.

children.name: excel.fileName
Example - set the default Excel file name

children.description: Specifies the file name of the exported Excel file.

children.name: excel
children.description: Configures the Kendo UI Spreadsheet Excel export settings.

children.name: headerWidth
children.description: The width of the header column in pixels.

children.name: headerHeight
children.description: The height of the header row in pixels.

children.name: columns
children.description: The number of columns in the document.

children.name: columnWidth
children.description: The default column width in pixels.

children.name: activeSheet
children.description: The name of the currently active sheet.Must match one of the (sheet names)[#configuration-sheets.name] exactly.
